name: Sports World Mix Quiz | The Sports Challenge | 10 Questions

questions.text: In Euro 2008, Greece was the only team with 0 points, but did not have the lowest goal differential.  Which team has the dubious honor of having the lowest goal differential in the tournament?
questions.explanation:
France.

	France gave up 6 goals in 3 matches and only scored 1 goal.  France's goal differential of -5.  Poland had a goal differential of -3.  Austria and Romania had a goal differential -4.

questions.text: Who was the first non-American U.S. Open female tennis champion?
questions.explanation:
Mabel Cahill.

	Mabel Cahill, born in Ireland, won the fifth and sixth women's U.S. Open in 1891 and 1892. Molla Bjurstedt Mallory, who was the next foreign champion, didn't win until 24 years later.

questions.text: Who was the first team to ever beat the Packers at their home of Lambeau Field during the playoffs?
questions.explanation:
Falcons.

	Michael Vick and the Falcons came into Lambeau in 2002, and beat the NFC North Champions 27-7 in the NFL playoffs.

questions.text: Who was the captain of the Australian Test cricket team from 1999-2004?
questions.explanation:
Steve Waugh.

	Steve Waugh played 168 Tests, and captained 57.

questions.text: In the 2008-09 soccer Premier League, which Northern Irish football center back played for Manchester United?
questions.explanation:
Jonny Evans.

	Evans was loaned to Royal Antwerp and Sunderland, before making his debut appearance for Manchester United in the 2007-08 League Cup.  Jonny became a member of the first team the following season.

questions.text: In the 2009 cricket Indian Premier League, which team had a person who played the role of coach and also captain?
questions.explanation:
Rajasthan Royals.

	Shane Warne was the coach and the captain of Rjasthan Royals.

questions.text: In Euro 2008, which team did not advance to the quarterfinals from group A?
questions.explanation:
Czech Republic.

	Czech Republic finished the group in 3rd place with 3 points. Turkey took second place in the group with 6 points.

questions.text: Which of these tennis greats did not start out his career playing for Great Britain?
questions.explanation:
Greg Rusedski.

	Greg was born in 1973, Montreal, Canada. He got his British passport through his British mother (his father was German-born of Polish-Ukrainian descent). He was a very promising junior player in Canada in the 1980s, and subsequently caused some anger in Canada when he decided to adopt British citizenship and play for Britain in 1995.

questions.text: World tennis star Rafael Nadal was born on the Spanish island of Mallorca into a family of renowned sportsmen.  One of his uncles was a former professional soccer player for which Spanish team?
questions.explanation:
Barcelona.

	Rafa's Uncle Miguel Angel played for Barcelona and also Mallorca. His nickname was the 'Beast of Barcelona'.  His Uncle Toni was also a respected tennis player in his own right. He then turned his hand to coaching his young nephew.

questions.text: Which of the following had captained Australia for the most Test matches?
questions.explanation:
Allan Border.

	Border captained Australia on 93 occasions. Waugh did so on 57, Simpson on 39, and Bradman on 24.
